intro: Aristolochia rethyae, commonly known as the Malagasy birthwort, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Aristolochiaceae family and is characterized by its unique, tubular flowers that resemble a horse's hoof. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its medicinal properties and ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
